title: Create test case generation app for Word documents

requirements.text: Implement file upload functionality that accepts Word document files (.doc, .docx) containing user stories and requirements

quotes: takes word documents of user stories, requirements

acceptanceCriteria: User can select and upload Word document files from their device
Upload interface clearly indicates accepted file formats (.doc, .docx)
System provides feedback during upload process

requirements.text: Parse uploaded Word documents to extract user stories and requirements text content

quotes: takes word documents of user stories, requirements

acceptanceCriteria: Backend successfully extracts text content from .doc and .docx files
Parsed content preserves structure and formatting relevant to requirements analysis
System handles parsing errors gracefully with appropriate error messages

requirements.text: Generate functional test cases with detailed steps and preconditions when applicable based on parsed requirements

quotes: generate 100% correct test cases with steps, precondition (if needed)
The test cases should be functional

acceptanceCriteria: Each functional test case includes numbered execution steps
Preconditions are listed when necessary for test execution
Test cases accurately reflect the functional requirements from the document
Generated test cases are comprehensive and actionable

requirements.text: Generate boundary test cases that test limits and edge conditions of the requirements

quotes: The test cases should be functional, boundary, edge cases

acceptanceCriteria: System identifies numerical limits, ranges, and boundaries from requirements
Boundary test cases test minimum, maximum, and just-outside-boundary values
Test cases clearly identify which boundary condition is being tested

requirements.text: Generate edge case test cases that cover unusual or extreme scenarios

quotes: The test cases should be functional, boundary, edge cases

acceptanceCriteria: System generates test cases for empty inputs, null values, and special characters
Edge cases cover unusual but valid scenarios mentioned in requirements
Test cases identify potential system breaking points

requirements.text: Generate exploratory test cases that encourage creative testing approaches beyond specified requirements

quotes: The test cases should be functional, boundary, edge cases, exploratory

acceptanceCriteria: Exploratory test cases suggest areas for investigation and discovery
Test cases encourage testing of interactions between features
Generated exploratory scenarios are relevant to the application domain

requirements.text: Generate both positive test cases (expected behavior) and negative test cases (error handling and invalid inputs)

quotes: Consider positive and negative test cases

acceptanceCriteria: Positive test cases verify expected functionality works correctly
Negative test cases verify error handling for invalid inputs and operations
Each test case is clearly labeled as positive or negative
Coverage includes all major requirement scenarios

requirements.text: Order generated test cases in a natural execution sequence that follows logical testing flow

quotes: The sequence of test cases should be the natural order of execution

acceptanceCriteria: Test cases are ordered from setup/precondition tests to main functionality to cleanup
Dependencies between test cases are respected in the ordering
Sequence follows a logical progression that a tester would naturally follow
Test case numbering reflects execution order

requirements.text: Display generated test cases in an organized, readable format with clear categorization by test type (functional, boundary, edge, exploratory, positive, negative)

quotes: The test cases should be functional, boundary, edge cases, exploratory
Consider positive and negative test cases

acceptanceCriteria: Test cases are grouped by category with clear visual separation
Each test case displays test ID, title, steps, preconditions, and expected results
Interface allows users to easily navigate between test case categories
Users can export or copy generated test cases

requirements.text: Apply a professional, testing-focused visual design that emphasizes clarity and readability with a modern, sophisticated color scheme and clean typography
acceptanceCriteria: Design uses a cohesive color palette appropriate for a testing/QA tool
Typography is clear and optimized for reading technical content
Layout emphasizes information hierarchy and scanability
Visual style is consistent across all screens and components

constraints: Backend must use Motoko with single-actor architecture
Frontend must use React with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Shadcn components
All Motoko logic must reside in backend/main.mo
Do not modify immutable frontend paths (useInternetIdentity hooks, useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui)
nonGoals: Integration with external AI services or LLMs
Real-time collaborative editing of test cases
Integration with test management tools like JIRA or TestRail
Automated test execution or CI/CD pipeline integration
Support for file formats other than Word documents (.doc, .docx)
